section_01.section_summary: The series of lectures on Hebraic thought and learning was founded in memory of Mr. Arthur Davis, a renowned Hebrew scholar who dedicated his life to studying and interpreting the language. Davis's work contributed to the revival of Hebrew, which is unique among ritual languages in showing signs of renewing its old vitality. The concept of the Jews as a "Chosen People" has long been a source of irritation for non-Jews, with some critics arguing that it implies spiritual supremacy over other nations. This idea has been distorted and used by others, such as the Germans, to justify their own claims of special election and superiority. The lectures aim to explore and discuss topics of Jewish interest, starting with the concept of the "Chosen People" and its implications.
